Subaru Forester 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Subaru Forester 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Subaru Forester changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Subaru Forester 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

The Japanese all-wheel-drive specialists are economically sound and highly profitable for years, even though they do not sell more than 10,000 cars per year in Germany. The Forester is the most popular model with over 40 percent share. And so it is no wonder that the Japanese show their self-esteem with the new top model Forester XT.

From the outside is synonymous and the 4.60 meters long Forester XT unimpressive - only at the vertical air openings in the front outet itself the power SUV. Inside and outside, it still offers a well-maintained Japanese design with many corners and edges. But it also stands out soothingly from the stylish round SUV uniform - but this is a matter of taste.

The Subaru is based on an off-road vehicle interior with a lot of black plastic - functional but not sporty. The soft leather seats are comfortable, but offer little side support. The list of equipment leaves nothing to be desired: seat heating, reversing camera, xenon, automatic, navigation, panoramic wheel and multimedia from Harman Kardon.

The space conditions in the rear have grown, there is now more leg and headlessness. What did not like, however, was the electric tailgate, which opens much too slowly and also does not swing up far enough. The luggage compartment offers just over 500 liters more volume than its predecessor.

The turbocharger whistles quietly, while the 240 hp two-liter unit is well connected to the gas. And the infinitely variable automatic, which still a little tired at the weaker XV, is a well-functioning unit with the running-quiet engine. Harmoniously accelerates the Boxer Turbo in 7.5 seconds to 60 pace and develops a powerful and powerful sound.

 

CarAndDriver Test Results

Zero to 60 mph: 8.6 sec
Zero to 100 mph: 25.1 sec
Zero to 110 mph: 35.3 sec
Rolling start, 5-60 mph: 8.9 sec
Top gear, 30-50 mph: 4.4 sec
Top gear, 50-70 mph: 5.8 sec
Standing ¼-mile: 16.7 sec @ 85 mph
Top speed (drag limited): 122 mph
Braking, 70-0 mph: 166 ft
Roadholding, 300-ft-dia skidpad*: 0.78 g
Curb weight: 3466 lb
C/D observed fuel economy: 19 mpg
*Stability-control-inhibited
